summary: Hi! Thank you for visiting my profile. Smart people are always welcome here. My name is Silvia, and I am a passionate learner who wants to make a positive impact in people's lives. I have a background as a physiotherapist, and I have dedicated my career to science and education. I have already taught hundreds of movement science students, and my previous research focused on (i) exercise interventions to enhance mobility and prevent falls in older adults and in people with disabilities, and on (ii) obesity and sarcopenia as risk factors for falls. I also followed biostatistics courses and have experience as a statistical consultant. Recently, I relocated from Brazil to the Netherlands, and I am currently learning Dutch to continue to make a positive contribution to the society. LET'S CONNECT!

profile_positions.description:
Worked on 70 research projects of undergraduate, Masters and PhD students of health sciences.
Tasks performed include statistical advice, analysis, and training. Main software used: SPSS,
Comprehensive Meta-analysis, RevMan, GraphPad Prism, Covidence Review, and EndNote.
profile_positions.title: Statistical Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Was member of the academic management team of the health sciences courses. Tasks performed included elaboration, implementation, and update of pedagogical plans. 
- Taught Human Physiology, Exercise Physiology, Biomechanics, Biostatistics and Epidemiology for undergraduate health science students. 
- Supervised 10 undergraduate physiotherapy and physical education students in their research projects.
- Investigated the effects of hippotherapy on mobility-related variables in people with disabilities (e.g., multiple sclerosis and cerebral palsy).
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description: - Supervised two master’s and one PhD students in the process of synthesizing evidence on (i) the prevalence of sarcopenia and osteoporosis in people with chronic kidney disease and (ii) the influence of sarcopenia on the risk of end-stage renal disease, hospitalization, and mortality.
profile_positions.title: Research Collaborator

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and conducted a cohort study to investigate the influence of obesity and sarcopenia on the incidence of falls in women aged 60 years and older. Won the 2020 Young Investigator Award Travel Grant, European College of Sport Science.
- Performed a systematic review to investigate the effects of virtual reality games on mobility skills in community-dwelling older adults; and wrote a book chapter regarding principles and practical uses of virtual reality games as a physical therapy strategy.
- Co-designed a clinical trial to investigate the effects of a balance exercise circuit on the prevention of falls in people aged 60 years and older.
- Conducted the intervention and collected data from a clinical trial investigating the effects of protein supplementation and resistance training on body composition and physical function in people 2-7 years post-bariatric surgery.
- Analyzed data and wrote scientific reports of a cross-sectional study evaluating plantar pressure distribution during running in children aged 4-10 years.
- Was teaching assistant in Biostatistics for graduate students. 
- Supervised 5 undergraduate physical education students in their research projects.
- Was member of the organization committee of 3 academic congresses and 2 workshops.
- Presented her work in 7 scientific conferences. 
- Published 30 peer-reviewed articles in top ranking physiotherapy, exercise science, and gerontology journals.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Phd Candidate

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and conducted a cross-sectional study to investigate the relationship between obesity, postural instability, and gait impairment in community-dwellers older women. Main equipment employed: dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry, Biodex isokinetic dynamometer, EMED pressure platform, AMTI force platform, and QuickScreen Clinical Falls Risk Assessment.
- Conducted the intervention and collected data from a clinical trial evaluating the effects of resistance exercise on blood pressure reactivity to mental stress in older hypertensive women.
- Was teaching assistant in Exercise Physiology, Physical Activity for Special Populations, and Principles of Resistance Training for undergraduate physical education students.
profile_positions.title: Research Master's student

profile_positions.description:
- Performed a systematic review and meta-analysis of observational studies, providing evidence that obesity increases the risk of falls in people aged 60 years and older. Was awarded the most outstanding study presented at 10° COGER, Brasília, Brazil. 
- Conducted mediation analysis to understand mechanistic links between obesity and falls, using data from a cohort study of 246 Brazilian women aged 60 years and older. Presented the work at the 66th Annual Meeting of the American College of Sports Medicine, Orlando, US.
- Was speaker at the 8th Biennial Australia and New Zealand Falls Prevention Conference, Hobart, Australia.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Phd Candidate

volunteer_experiences.description: Provides weekly mentorships to young adults who are learning English as a second language.

Provides twice a week physical training to a multicultural group of women living in The
Hague's Schilderswijk. The training is delivered using classical gym equipment.

Provided weekly physiotherapy sessions for people with social vulnerability. The sessions were
conducted in a clinic with conventional physiotherapy equipment for orthopedics.
